text:
- Banks in Asia are
facing increasing pressure
to improve customer satisfaction

while reducing costs amidst
a thriving fintech scene.
At Union Bank of the Philippines,
we've embraced the concept of ubuntu
which means collaboration.
We have our unique value proposition
that we bring to the table.

By collaborating with
partners such as fintechs,

we're providing better
value to our customers.
Union Bank of the Philippines' vision
is to become the first bank in the country
operating fully on the cloud,
with AWS as our platform of choice.

In line with this vision, we
migrated from an on-premises
to the state-of-the-art Finacle Digital
Banking Solutions Suite on cloud.

The Finacle solutions deployed
include customer onboarding,

deposits, loans, payments
and trade finance.
With this move, we're looking at migrating

over 8 million customer
accounts to the new software
as a service or SaaS platform.

The end-to-end managed services
of Finacle on the AWS cloud

will empower the bank to
focus on our core businesses

and scale our retail and
corporate banking operations.
We're looking to benefit
from a steady stream of innovations,
a lower TCO and a quick time to market.

Finacle's extensive open
API repository on the cloud
will also give us the agility to integrate

and co-innovate with
ecosystem partners easily.

The fintechs we work
with can directly access

a secure API sandbox to develop
and propose new services,
cater to our customers,

serving more Filipinos by
working with Union Bank's APIs.
It's a win-win scenario.

The move from on-premises
to the AWS cloud-based
Finacle Digital Banking Solution Suite
is a strategic step in that direction.

This investment will see
exponential benefits,

enabling us to enhance
digitization and automation
across the bank
and ultimately delivering
a world-class digital customer experience.
